link-text: What is a sandwich? (with image, tweets)
link-description:
allthingslinguistic:

Scientists canât agree on what constitutes a species. Imagine what happens when you ask them to define âsandwich.â As usual, the tweets are only slightly reordered to maintain some semblance of narrative.

Is a taco a sandwich?

What about a quesadilla, a panini, an ice cream sandwich, a wrap, a burrito, a calzone, a burger, a hot dog, a sâmore, a folded pizza, or a twinkie?Â 

This twitter discussion, although entertaining,Â would probably have benefited from an approach using prototype theory instead of a definition-based model.

For example, instead of trying to decide whether two slices of leavened bread is necessary for a sandwich (what about open-faced or pita sandwiches?), we can agree that ham-and-swiss is a very prototypical sandwich, paninis and wraps slightly less so, and a sâmore or folded pizza are very un-prototypical but could possibly be considered edge-case sandwiches.
